    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        main() method. Makes the class executable and does some matrix ops just for demonstration.
        Parameters:
        args - command line args

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Deallocate the matrix. Since this class allocates memory through JNI calls you *MUST* call this on every Mzd object when you are done with it.

      • echelonize

        public int echelonize(boolean full)
        Row-reduce a matrix
        Parameters:
        full - - if true return reduced row echelon form, if false upper triangular
        Returns:
        the rank of the matrix

      • solveLeft

        public static Mzd solveLeft(Mzd A,
                            Mzd B,
                            int cutoff,
                            boolean inconsistency_check)
        Solves A X = B with A and B matrices. returns a new Mzd object, X
        Parameters:
        A -
        B -
        cutoff - - Minimal dimension for Strassen recursion (default: 0).
        inconsistency_check - - decide whether or not to perform a check for incosistency (faster without but output not defined if system is not consistent).
        Returns:

      • kernelLeft

        public Mzd kernelLeft(int cutoff)
        Solve X for A X = 0. If r is the rank of the nr x nc matrix A, return the nc x (nc-r) matrix X such that A*X == 0 and that the columns of X are linearly independent.
        Parameters:
        cutoff - - Minimal dimension for Strassen recursion (default: 0).
        Returns:

      • randomize

        public void randomize()
        Fill matrix M with uniformly distributed bits.

      • print

        public void print()
        Print out the matrix. Use this instead of trying toString().

        Print out compact info about the matrix.

      • concat

        public static Mzd concat(Mzd A,
                         Mzd B)
        Concatenate B to A and write the result to C. That is, [ A ], [ B ] to [ A B ] = C
        Parameters:
        A -
        B -
        Returns:
        C

      • stack

        public static Mzd stack(Mzd A,
                        Mzd B)
        Stack A on top of B and write the result to C. That is, [ A ], [ B ] to [ A ] = C [ B ]
        Parameters:
        A -
        B -
        Returns:
        C

      • multiplyRight

        public void multiplyRight(Mzd B)
        Naive cubic matrix multiplication on the right. Object-oriented version. Replaces [this] with [this][B]. Disposes of the old [this] matrix.
        Parameters:
        B -

                      Mzd B)
        Same thing as above, but static method
        Parameters:

        B -
        Returns:

      • transpose

        public void transpose()
        Transpose the matrix. This function uses the fact that: [ A B ]T [AT CT] [ C D ] = [BT DT] and thus rearranges the blocks recursively. This version replaces [this] with [this]', and disposes of the old matrix. It behaves like it is operating in-place.

      • transpose

        public static Mzd transpose(Mzd A)
        Transpose a matrix. This function uses the fact that: [ A B ]T [AT CT] [ C D ] = [BT DT] and thus rearranges the blocks recursively. This is the static version that takes an Mzd and returns a new Mzd.
        Parameters:
        A -
        Returns:
        new matrix containing transpose.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Mzd B)
        Tests if B==this as matrices
        Parameters:
        B -
        Returns:
        true or false

      • copyRow

        public static void copyRow(Mzd B,
                           int i,
                           Mzd A,
                           int j)
        copy row j from A to row i from B. The offsets of A and B must match and the number of columns of A must be less than or equal to the number of columns of B.
        Parameters:
        B -
        i -
        A -
        j -

      • copyRows

        public static void copyRows(Mzd B,
                            int i,
                            Mzd A,
                            int j,
                            int numRows)
        copy numRows rows of A, starting at row j, to B, starting at row i There is no corresponding function in m4ri, so this is implemented in terms of single row copies in the c wrapper
        Parameters:
        B -
        i -
        A -
        j -
        numRows -

      • submatrix

        public Mzd submatrix(Mzd S,
                     int lowr,
                     int lowc,
                     int highr,
                     int highc)
        Copy a submatrix. This version takes the dest matrix M as a parameter and fills it in. If M is null it allocates the matrix and returns it. Note that the upper bounds are not included.
        Parameters:
        S - destination matrix (if null it will be allocated and returned)
        lowr - - start row
        lowc - - start column
        highr - - stop row
        highc - - stop column
        Returns:

      • vsIntersect

        public static Mzd vsIntersect(Mzd U,
                              Mzd W)
        Return a matrix whose rows span the intersection of the rowspaces of U and W. Not a direct interface to an m4ri routine, this is a natural place to put this functionality. This computes a basis for the intersection of the rowspace of two matrices (same column dimension).
        Parameters:
        U -
        W -
        Returns:
        - a new matrix containing the basis for the intersection in its rows.
